intro: Tristania microphylla, commonly known as the small-leaved tristania, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of white to pale yellow flowers. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade. Tristania microphylla is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to care for in a garden setting.
